dt-api.name: stateRestore.state().rename()

type.parameter: The new name to be given to the state.
type.description: Renames a stored state from the StateRestore extension.
type.returns: Returns an DataTables API for chaining.

dt-api.description:
This method provides the ability to rename a state that is managed by the `-init stateRestore` extension.
`-api stateRestore.state().rename()` takes one argument, `newIdentifier` that is the new identifier for the selected state. It renames the state retrieved by the previous call to `-api stateRestore.state()`.
A Datatables API is returned so that further chaining can occur.
If the `-init stateRestore.rename` initialisation option is set to `false` then this API method will not do anything.
